Posts.Content: busymomof4 wrote: I had my Mammogram 2 weeks ago.  Got a call to go back for a mag view, which I did on Tuesday.  The radiologist read the results and said I need a biopsy.  The microcalcifications are clustered.  I'm 41, first mammo.  Scary, I know you all have been there.  I'm trying not to be all worked up over it, and I know 80% are B9, but that is still 20% that aren't, and I am a little panicked.  Plus, I'm a little frustrated with all the "experts" (my friends) who keep telling me to not worry, that it is nothing.  If it was nothing (which I know it probably is), they would have told me at the 2nd mammo that it was nothing and to go home.  I KNOW I am being a bit irrational, especially since I know the statistics.  But, still I am scared.  There, I said it to all you cyber people.  I feel better.  Here is my problem, I don't know what questions to ask my surgeon?  I know she will be giving me a ton of information, but I also know that I won't get to ask her questions later since it is so hard to get a hold of these Drs.  Any advice?  I want to be as prepared as possible.  Please let me know what I should ask. Thanks!!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: HELP NEEDED...Microcalcifications- biopsy coming up busymomof4 leaf

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2008 01:11PM busymomof4 wrote: I go today to get the results of my biopsy.  I might be a big wimp (I don't think I am though)...but the biopsy (stereotactic needle core biopsy) HURT.  I am ok today, but really nervous.  Everyone keeps saying not to worry and that it will be fine, but it seems really surreal that it could really be cancer.  I had my biopsy done last Tuesday.  It's been a long 6 days.  I called on Friday to both my OBGYN and my surgeon to try to get them to tell me on the phone that everything was fine.  They didn't return my calls, although, my 11 year old daughter said they called on Friday afternoon.  I had given them cell phone as my main number, so I am thinking it was to remind me about my appointment today (as if I could forget).  Anyway, all you ladies are so awesome with your support.  I do appreciate you letting me VENT.  :-)
Posts.Title: HELP NEEDED...Microcalcifications- biopsy coming up busymomof4 leaf

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2008 01:53PM busymomof4 wrote: HA HA!!  Alcohol would have been good!!!  Thanks for the giggle.
Posts.Title: HELP NEEDED...Microcalcifications- biopsy coming up busymomof4 leaf

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2008 05:37PM busymomof4 wrote: Thanks Deb!   I am a girl who likes to be prepared, so I appreciate the help with the questions.  Sometimes I think I am doing too much research!  I keep reading the 80% rule, but then rules are made to be broken, and then I read about so many who like you, had a negative biopsy and then were later diagnosed. You are an inspiration.  I really appreciate it.  :-)  I'll keep my chin up and try to stop freaking out.
Posts.Title: HELP NEEDED...Microcalcifications- biopsy coming up busymomof4 leaf

Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2008 02:30PM busymomof4 wrote: All results came back...B9!!!  Woo hoo.  Now I have to have another biopsy to remove the rest of the calcifications and the lump.  I forget what the lump is called....something with a P....I guess 30% of the time it can lead to cancer, so I said, LETS GET IT OUT. Thanks to all for all your support, and I am praying that everyone else gets great news!!!! Katherine
Posts.Title: HELP NEEDED...Microcalcifications- biopsy coming up busymomof4 leaf

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2008 02:39PM busymomof4 wrote: Hi LB-  I read your post and it is similiar to my story.  I had my first mammo about a month ago.  I was called back (I didn't ask why, I just went).  The tech told me that they found clustered microcalifications.  They read my 2nd mammo right then (the radiologist did) and decided that they needed to do a stereotactic biopsy.  That part was kind of yucky, but the WORST part was waiting for the results.  I had my biopsy on a Tuesday, and didn't find out until the following Monday what the results were.  Thankfully, all was B9.  I have a pappalomia (spelling?) and a fibroadenoma.  I am having both removed next week, on Nov 11.  I think the reason you don't see as many stories on here of it NOT being cancer, is because most of the gals drop off once they are B9.   Here is hoping your results come back soon and are B9 too!!!
Posts.Title: Please help, just joined LB2008 Dukemom2
